qcnn module

class qcnn.EquivQCNN(num_qubits: int, num_measured: int, trans_inv: bool, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: object

get_circuit()[source]
class qcnn.QCNN(num_qubits: int, num_measured: int, trans_inv: bool = True, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: object

Quantum Convolutional Neural Network constructed with the specified architecture.

Parameters:

  • num_qubits (int) – Number of qubits in the QCNN.

  • num_measured (int) – Number of qubits to be measured at the end of the circuit. For \(L\) class classification, we measure ceil(log2(num_classes)) qubits.

  • trans_inv (bool) – i.e., whether all the filters in each layer share the same parameters. (To be implemented).

Keyword Arguments:

qnn_ver (str) – Name of the QNN architecture predefined in .

Example

>>> qcnn = QCNN(num_qubits = 4, num_measured = 1, qnn_ver = "U_TTN")
>>> qcnn = QCNN(num_qubits = 4, num_measured = 1, conv_filters = "U_TTN",
...         pooling = "Poolin_ansatz1")
get_circuit() → Tuple[Callable, List[int]][source]

Function to return quantum circuit constructed with the architecture specified for the QCNN instance.

Returns:

Tuple of a Callable representing the quantum circuit and a list of integers corresponding to the qubits to be measured at the end of the circuit.

Return type:

Tuple[Callable, List[int]]
